sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"拖，拉"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: drag, draw, pull, haul, tug, tow, jerk
means: drag ： 指沿斜坡而上或水平方向缓慢地拖或拉十分沉重的人或物。作借喻时可指把人硬拉扯过来。
draw ： 指将人或物朝出力者的方向拖，不涉及力的大小，含平稳意味，常作借喻用。
pull ： 最普通用词，包含本组其它各词的一些意思，可指朝各个方向拉，侧重一时或突然拉动的动作。
haul ： 指用力拖或拉，不涉及方向，多作航海用词。
tug ： 多指一阵阵地用力拖或拉，但不一定使被拉的人或物移动。
tow ： 特指用绳子或链条等拖或拉本身无动力或无法使用自身动力的东西。

word_mean: 型盒下部：义齿型盒的下部或模型侧面，装有盖
又称“下箱”。浇注时铸型的下部组元。
作用于航空器上，平行于航迹且与飞行速度方向相反的气动力分量。
为达到某一抓力，锚在水底所需拖曳的距离。

sentence.Network_en: Use your mouse to drag the pictures to their new size.
sentence.Network_cn: 用鼠标拖动图片，将其调整为新的尺寸。

sentence.Network_en: There's no telling how long the talks could drag on.
sentence.Network_cn: 谁也说不准谈判还会拖多久。

sentence.Network_en: I find it really hard to drag myself out and exercise regularly.
sentence.Network_cn: 我发现要让我自己定期出门锻炼真的很难。

jx.jx_en_mean: walk slowly and wearily or with difficulty
make damaging allegations about someone or something
jx.jx_cn_mean: 中伤，损害，将…拖进浑水里

lj.lj_ly: he felt enough loyalty to his old school not to drag its name through the mud.
lj.lj_ls: 他对母校的忠诚足以使他不去损害她的名誉。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)dress up in clothes more conventionally worn by the opposite sex

jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)胡乱马虎地把（孩子）拉扯大

lj.lj_ly: would you have her dragged up by a succession of au pairs?.
lj.lj_ls: 难道你愿意让一个接一个的寄住妇女把她胡乱拉扯大？。

jx.jx_en_mean: To act or work with intentional slowness; delay
jx.jx_cn_mean: 拖延：在行动中或工作中有意延缓、拖拉

lj.lj_ly: “The bureaucracy has been known to drag its feet in implementing directives with which it disagrees”(&b{Henry A. Kissinger})
lj.lj_ls: “政府机构在执行它持异议的指示时有意拖拉，这是出了名的”(&b{亨利A.基辛格})

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old English dragan or Old Norse draga 'to draw'; the noun partly from Middle Low German dragge 'grapnel'

entry.def: If you drag something, you pull it along the ground, often with difficulty.

example.ex: He got up and dragged his chair towards the table.
example.tran: 他站起来把他的椅子拖向桌子。

entry.tran: (电脑操作中)用鼠标拖动，用鼠标改变（尺寸或形状）
entry.def: To drag a computer image means to use the mouse to move the position of the image on the screen, or to change its size or shape.

example.ex: Use your mouse to drag the pictures to their new size.
example.tran: 用鼠标拖动图片,将其调整为新的尺寸。

entry.def: If someone drags you somewhere, they pull you there, or force you to go there by physically threatening you.

example.ex: The vigilantes dragged the men out of the vehicles...
example.tran: 治安人员硬把那些人拉下车。

example.ex: There were no signs she'd been dragged across the grass.
example.tran: 没有迹象表明她是被硬拖着穿过草地的。

entry.def: If someone drags you somewhere you do not want to go, they make you go there.

example.ex: When you can drag him away from his work, he can also be a devoted father...
example.tran: 如果你能把他硬从工作中拉回来，他也会是个尽心尽责的父亲。

example.ex: I've been dragged back from Australia for no sufficient reason.
example.tran: 没有充分的理由，我就从澳大利亚被硬叫了回来。

entry.def: If you say that you drag yourself somewhere, you are emphasizing that you have to make a very great effort to go there.

example.ex: I find it really hard to drag myself out and exercise regularly.
example.tran: 我发现要让我自己定期出门锻炼真的很难。

example.ex: ...if you manage to drag yourself away from the luxury of the hotel.
example.tran: 如果你能舍弃酒店的奢侈享受

entry.def: If you drag your foot or your leg behind you, you walk with great difficulty because your foot or leg is injured in some way.

example.ex: He was barely able to drag his poisoned leg behind him...
example.tran: 他极费力地拖着那条中毒的腿走路。

example.ex: He drags his leg, and he can hardly lift his arm.
example.tran: 他拖着腿，几乎举不起他的胳膊。

entry.tran: 用网(或钩子)搜索(河或湖底)
entry.def: If the police drag a river or lake, they pull nets or hooks across the bottom of it in order to look for something.

example.ex: Yesterday police frogmen dragged a small pond on the Common.
example.tran: 昨天警方的蛙人在公用草地上的一个小池塘里打捞。

entry.tran: (时间)过得很慢;（活动）单调乏味地进行，拖沓地进行
entry.def: If a period of time or an event drags, it is very boring and seems to last a long time.

example.ex: The minutes dragged past...
example.tran: 时间一分钟一分钟地熬过去。

example.ex: The pacing was uneven, and the early second act dragged.
example.tran: 节奏忽快忽慢，第二幕前半场太过拖沓。

entry.def: If something is a drag on the development or progress of something, it slows it down or makes it more difficult.

example.ex: The satellite acts as a drag on the shuttle...
example.tran: 卫星成了航天飞机的累赘。

example.ex: Spending cuts will put a drag on growth.
example.tran: 缩减开支会减缓增长速度。

entry.tran: 令人不快的事;无聊的事
entry.def: If you say that something is a drag, you mean that it is unpleasant or very dull.

example.ex: As far as shopping for clothes goes, it's a drag...
example.tran: 逛街买衣服是件挺没意思的事。

example.ex: A dry sandwich is a drag to eat.
example.tran: 放干的三明治很难吃。

entry.def: If you take a drag on a cigarette or pipe that you are smoking, you take in air through it.

example.ex: He took a drag on his cigarette, and exhaled the smoke.
example.tran: 他吸了一口烟，吐出了烟雾。

entry.tran: (物体在空气或液体中移动时所受到的)阻力，抗力
entry.def: Drag is the resistance to the movement that is experienced by something that is moving through air or through a fluid.

example.ex: The drag of those extra air molecules brought the satellite crashing to Earth.
example.tran: 额外的空气分子阻力使得卫星坠毁到了地球上。

entry.def: Drag is the wearing of women's clothes by a male entertainer.

example.ex: Entertainment is laid on too, in the form of drag on Wednesdays and strippers on Sundays...
example.tran: 还安排了娱乐活动，星期三是男扮女装演出，星期天是脱衣舞演出。

example.ex: The neighborhood is given over to performers, stilt walkers and drag queens.
example.tran: 社区变成了玩杂耍的、踩高跷的和扮装皇后的天地。

entry.def: If you drag your feet or drag your heels, you delay doing something or do it very slowly because you do not want to do it.

example.ex: The government, he claimed, was dragging its feet.
example.tran: 他声称政府在故意拖延。

means.word_mean: 1. the phenomenon of resistance to motion through a fluid
2. something that slows or delays progress;

sentences.sentence: "taxation is a drag on the economy"
"too many laws are a drag on the use of new land"
"peeling potatoes is a drag"

means.word_mean: 4. clothing that is conventionally worn by the opposite sex (especially women's clothing when worn by a man);

sentences.sentence: "he went to the party dressed in drag"
"the waitresses looked like missionaries in drag"

means.word_mean: 5. a slow inhalation (as of tobacco smoke);

sentences.sentence: "he took a puff on his pipe"
"he took a drag on his cigarette and expelled the smoke slowly"

means.word_mean: 6. the act of dragging (pulling with force);

sentences.sentence: "the drag up the hill exhausted him"
"He dragged the big suitcase behind him"
"These worries were dragging at him"
"haul stones"
"haul nets"

means.word_mean: 3. force into some kind of situation, condition, or course of action;

sentences.sentence: "They were swept up by the events"
"don't drag me into this business"

means.word_mean: 4. move slowly and as if with great effort

sentences.sentence: "But in so many other areas we still are dragging"
"draw a deep breath"
"draw on a cigarette"

means.word_mean: 7. use a computer mouse to move icons on the screen and select commands from a menu;

sentences.sentence: "drag this icon to the lower right hand corner of the screen"

means.word_mean: 9. search (as the bottom of a body of water) for something valuable or lost
10. persuade to come away from something attractive or interesting;

sentences.sentence: "He dragged me away from the television set"

means.word_mean: 11. proceed for an extended period of time;

sentences.sentence: "The speech dragged on for two hours"

auth_sentence.content: We never wanted to drag the region into war.
auth_sentence.res_content: We never wanted to drag the region into war.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We never wanted to drag the region into war.

auth_sentence.content: He had all the necessary tuyaux, unlimited drag.
auth_sentence.res_content: He had all the necessary tuyaux, unlimited drag.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He had all the necessary tuyaux, unlimited drag.

auth_sentence.content: She smiled and took a drag on the cigarette.
auth_sentence.res_content: She smiled and took a drag on the cigarette.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She smiled and took a drag on the cigarette.

stems_affixes.word_buile: drag拉,拖,绘画+ft→n.草稿,草案,草图 v. 起草,为……制作草图
drag拉,拖,绘画+ft→n.草稿,草案,草图 v. 起草,为……制作草图

means.word_mean: (使…)在地上拖拉; 慢吞吞地走, 磨蹭

sentences.en: The heavy coach is dragging along.
sentences.cn: 重载的马车吃力地行进着。

sentences.en: The bottom of her long dress dragged in the dust.
sentences.cn: 她长衣裳的下摆拖着尘土。

sentences.en: They dragged the fallen tree clear of the road.
sentences.cn: 他们把倒下的树从路上拖走。

sentences.en: The ship dragged her anchor during the storm.
sentences.cn: 船在暴风雨中拖动了锚链。

sentences.en: They're dragging the river for the body of the missing boy.
sentences.cn: 他们在河底打捞失踪男孩的尸体。

sentences.en: He took last drags at his cigarette and stood up.
sentences.cn: 他抽完最后几口烟, 站了起来。

sentences.en: She loves her family, but they're a drag on her career.
sentences.cn: 她热爱自己的家庭, 但家庭却是她事业的拖累。

jushi.english: The heavy coach is dragging along.
jushi.chinese: 重载的马车吃力地行进着。

jushi.english: The bottom of her long dress dragged in the dust.
jushi.chinese: 她长衣裳的下摆拖着尘土。
